conclusion: The problem involves maximizing the power-source output efficiency using resistors R1 and R2.
The graph shows the relationship between the terminal voltage U (in volts) and the current I (in amperes) for the power source and resistors R1 and R2.
The internal resistance of the power source can be determined from the slope of its line on the graph.
The resistance R1 can be determined from the slope of its line on the graph.
The resistance R2 can be determined from the slope of its line on the graph.
The efficiency of the power source is given by the ratio of the power delivered to the load to the power supplied by the source.
The efficiency is maximized when the resistance R is as large as possible compared to the internal resistance r.
Resistor R2 has a larger resistance than R1, so using R2 alone will result in a higher efficiency.
To maximize the power-source output efficiency, connect resistor R2 alone to the circuit.
